basics.name: Kai Lin
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.B.A. in Accounting and Management Information Systems in the Shidler College of Business at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2023.

education.institution: Shidler College Of Business, University Of Hawaii At Manoa, Honolulu, HI
education.area: Bachelor of Business Administration in Accounting & Management Information Systems (Expected Fall, 2023)

work.summary: Aided in operataions of running the store
highlights: Led three employees during the store hours, opening and closing
Trained five newly hired employees on how to complete responsibilities, work cash register and stock inventory
Managed and reviewed inventory throughout the week
Provided customer service by attending to any issues that customers may have had

work.summary: Helped in the preparation of tax returns for individuals and trusts

volunteer.organization: Accounting Club, Shidler College Of Business
highlights: Coordinate with the Chapter President of IMA to promote IMA opportunities to over 40 student
Complete 4 scholarship applications throughout the year to raise money for the club to utilize for members
Maintain connections and relations with alumni to assist in events for the benefit of the club members

volunteer.organization: Shidler College Of Business, University Of Hawaii At Manoa
volunteer.summary: Mentor for incoming Direct Admission students into Shidler
highlights: Counsel 3 freshman in their transition to the beginning of their college career and facilitated in person meetings
Guide mentees in class selection, scheduling, utilization of campus resources, and joining extracurricular activities

awards.title: UH Manoa Provost Achievement Scholarship
awards.summary: A highly competitive scholarship that awards 80 students $10,000 per academic year to help pay for tuition

awards.title: Scholarship Recipient
awards.summary: Won $20,000 by competing with over 60 participants and 13 finalists by presenting an original business proposal to a panel of 7 committee members including board executives
